description: Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) attached to planning permission 2018/2789 in order to amend the internal arrangement of each dwelling
decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development as approved under application reference 2023/2614, unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the proposed development, to safeguard the visual amenity of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the locality consistent with Policies D1, D3 &amp; D4&nbsp; of the London Plan 2021 &amp; Policies LP1, LP2, &amp; LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2020.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of windows and doors as approved under application reference&nbsp;2023/2614, unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the proposed development, to safeguard the visual amenity of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the locality consistent with Policies D1, D3 &amp; D4 of the London Plan 2021 &amp; Policies LP1, LP2 &amp; LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2020.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of Sustainable Drainage System (SUDS) as approved under application reference 2021/2695 and shall be retained in perpetuity, unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><div><br></div><p>REASON: To address adaptation to, and mitigation of, climate change; provide sustainable urban drainage and manage surface water run-off as close to source as possible; enhance biodiversity values, and improve to the appearance and resilience of the building.</p>

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of cycle storage as approved under application reference 2023/2614 and shall be retained in perpetuity, unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the proposed development, to safeguard the visual amenity of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the locality consistent with Policies D1, D3 &amp; D4 of the London Plan 2021 &amp; Policies LP1, LP2 &amp; LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2020.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of refuse/ recycling storage as approved under application reference 2023/2614 and shall be retained in perpetuity, unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the proposed development, to safeguard the visual amenity of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the locality consistent with Policies D1, D3 &amp; D4 of the London Plan 2021 &amp; Policies LP1, LP2 &amp; LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2020.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended by any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development within Schedule 2, Part 1, Class(es) A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H and Schedule 2, Part 2, Class A to that Order shall be carried out without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure a satisfactory appearance to the development and a high quality of design, preserve and enhance the character and appearance of the dwellinghouses.</p><div><br></div>

<p>The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved (2021/2695) as part of the demolition and construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity</p>

<p>A soil sampling and analyses exercise shall be completed in any garden, area of landscaping and/or yard area. The results, assessment and recommendations shall be agreed with the Planning Authority before the recommendations are implemented. No occupation of the development shall take place until the agreed recommendations have been fully implemented and evidence of their implementation has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The sampling and analyses exercise and implementation of recommendations will be completed in line with the Council's guidance for 'Small scale investigation works in garden, landscaped and yard areas'. Any significant evidence of contamination encountered during the course of the development shall be notified to the Planning Authority and Contaminated Land Officer within 5 working day. All development shall cease in the affected area. Any additional or unforeseen contamination shall be dealt with as agreed with the Contaminated Land Officer. Where development has ceased in the affected area, it shall recommence upon written notification of the Planning Authority.</p><p>Reason: To protect existing and future residents from the risk of exposure to contamination.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of two Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of each of the single dwellinghouses hereby approved.</p><p>The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</p><p>REASON: in the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of hard and soft landscaping as approved under application reference 2023/2614 unless otherwise superseded as part of the drawings hereby approved or agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>All landscaping in accordance with the scheme, when approved, shall be carried out within the first planting (and seeding) season following completion of the development, and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of ten years, such maintenance to include the replacement of any plants that die, or are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance for the proposed development, to safeguard the visual amenity of neighbouring properties and the appearance of the locality consistent with Policies D1, D3 &amp; D4 of the London Plan 2021 &amp; Policies LP1, LP2 &amp; LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2020.&nbsp;</p>
